ns:ThreatCon.ns:Description: The ThreatCon is at level 1. No new attacks have come to light in the aftermath of the Java Exploit CVE-2013-2423.
ns:ThreatCon.ns:LongDescription:
No new attacks have come to light in the aftermath of the Java Exploit CVE-2013-2423. Please be aware of malware that masquerades as software updates and patches and only download the patch from the official website.

On April 23, 2013, it was discovered that CVE-2013-2423, one of the recently patched Java vulnerabilities was incorporated into exploit kits and seen in the wild.

Customers are advised to install all applicable updates as soon as possible.

Java Exploit CVE-2013-2423 Coverage
http://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/java-exploit-cve-2013-2423-coverage

Oracle Java SE Critical Patch Update
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/javacpuapr2013-1928497.html

Oracle Critical Patch Update
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpuapr2013-1899555.html

Oracle Java Runtime Environment CVE-2013-2423 Security Bypass Vulnerability
http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/59162

ns:ThreatCon.ns:Description: The ThreatCon is at level 2. On April 16, 2013, Oracle released security patches that contain updates for multiple vulnerabilities, including some associated with Java SE.
ns:ThreatCon.ns:LongDescription:
On April 16, 2013, Oracle released security patches that addressed vulnerabilities found in numerous supported products. The update included patches for multiple issues associated with Oracle Java SE which may allow remote exploitation without authentication.

Customers are advised to install all applicable updates as soon as possible.

Oracle Java SE Critical Patch Update
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/javacpuapr2013-1928497.html

Oracle Critical Patch Update
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpuapr2013-1899555.html

ns:ThreatCon.ns:Description: The ThreatCon is at level 2. Microsoft has released their scheduled security advisories for April 2013. Customers are advised to install all applicable updates as soon as possible.
ns:ThreatCon.ns:LongDescription:
On April 9, 2013, Microsoft released its scheduled patch update for April 2013. This month's update covers vulnerabilities in the Microsoft Windows operating system, Internet Explorer, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Server Software, Microsoft Windows, and Microsoft Security Software. Nine security bulletins have been released to address these issues.

Customers are advised to install all applicable updates as soon as possible.

Microsoft Security Bulletin Summary for April 2013
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms13-apr

ns:ThreatCon.ns:Description: The ThreatCon is at level 1. There has been no widespread exploitation of the vulnerabilities Microsoft and Adobe patched on March 12, 2013.
ns:ThreatCon.ns:LongDescription:
On March 12, 2013, Microsoft released its scheduled patch update for March 2013. This month's update covers vulnerabilities in the Microsoft Windows operating system, Internet Explorer, Office, Sharepoint, and Silverlight. Seven security bulletins have been released to address these issues.

On March 12, 2013, Adobe released a patch for Adobe Flash Player. This release addresses CVE-2013-0646, CVE-2013-0650, CVE-2013-1371, CVE-2013-1375. These updates address vulnerabilities that could cause a crash and potentially allow an attacker to take control of the affected system.

Customers are advised to install all applicable updates as soon as possible.

Microsoft Security Bulletin Summary for March 2013
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms13-mar

Adobe Security Bulletin: Security Update Available for Adobe Flash Player
http://www.adobe.com/support/security/bulletins/apsb13-09.html

Adobe Flash Player and AIR CVE-2013-0646 Remote Integer Overflow Vulnerability
http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/58436

Adobe Flash Player and AIR CVE-2013-0650 Use After Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/58440

Adobe Flash Player and AIR CVE-2013-1371 Memory Corruption Vulnerability
http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/58438

Adobe Flash Player and AIR CVE-2013-1375 Remote Heap Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/58439
